reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: FLC: Strengthening Management and Governance of the Women Youths and People with Disabilities Empowerment Fund in Tanzania 2021 -2023

description.narrative: What to be done and why? The project intends to contribute to improved livelihoods of Women Youths and People with Disabilities (WYPWD) in Tanzania. The project emanates from the current WYPWD Funding program of the government of Tanzania in trying to addr ess various gaps in WYPWDF delivery with the objective of enhancing its effectiveness and performance to increase employment creation and incomes as well as promote gender equality. Expected impact: Improved livelihoods of WYPWD in Tanzania.Direct project results/ outcomes:Improved governance management and accountability of WYPWDFOperationalization of the comprehensive strategy for monitoring WYPWDF at LGAs levelIncreased capacity of LGA officials in financial management and entrepreneurial skillsEnhanced access to loans by WYPWDIncreased budget allocation to WYPWDFIncreased number of WYPWD groups accessing loansIncreased number of WYPWD accessing information on loansStrengthened capacity of WYPWDF beneficiaries to operate profitable businessesLGAs setting budget for capacity building/training to beneficiaries and monitoringIncreased linkage between WYPWDF beneficiaries and services providers at LGAs levelDirect beneficiaries Women Youths and People with Disabilities from 25 districts ANSAF will target thre e groups in each district working in agriculture with about 15-25 members per group thereby engaging at least 1500 direct beneficiariesOutputs of the projectsOperationalization of the comprehensive strategy for monitoring WYPWDF at LGAs levelIncreased capa city of LGAs officials on financial management and entrepreneur skillsIncreased budget allocation to WYPWDF Increased number of WYPWD groups accessing loans Increased number of WYPWD accessing information on loansLGAs setting budget for capacity building/t raining to beneficiaries and monitoringIncreased linkage between WYPWDF beneficiaries and services providers at LGAs levelImplementing partners: ANSAF is the implementing partners; they will work closely with its network of over 80 members spread across Tanzania MDAs (including NEEC) regional secretariats the Tanzania Investment Center (TIC) and Small Industries Development Organization (SIDO); the private sector including the Tanzania Chamber of Commerce Industry and Agriculture (TCCIA) and microfinance institutions; as well as non-state actors promoting empowerment of WYPWD at LGAs? level. Link to the website: https://ansaf.or.tz/

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is a secondary priority area in this activity

Strengthening of the rights and status of women and girls is the main priority area in this activ ity
